entries.approach: Created comprehensive permission configuration with deny/ask/allow tiers
patterns: Use deny > ask > allow precedence for security
Block network tools to prevent data exfiltration
Put destructive commands in ask with dangerous patterns in deny
lessons: Claude Code permission patterns use :* for prefix matching at end only
Deny rules always take precedence over ask and allow

entries.approach: Created separate /do-tdd command for TDD enforcement with RED-GREEN-REFACTOR phases
patterns: Create separate command for distinct workflow instead of flags
Use test existence gate to enforce TDD (not just suggest)
Track workflow phases in loop state for resume capability
lessons: Commands in commands/ folder are auto-discovered by plugin system
User feedback: prefer explicit commands over additional flags for major features
TDD enforcement works via blocking gates, not warnings

entries.approach: Used /merge workflow to squash merge PR #24, auto-close issue #23, re-tag v3.7.0
patterns: Re-tag version after merge if tag was created pre-merge
Squash merge keeps main branch history clean
Use 'Closes #N' in PR body for auto-close of issues
lessons: GitHub auto-closes linked issues when PR is merged with 'Closes #N'
Tags can be safely deleted and recreated to point to correct commit
Delete feature branch after merge to keep repo clean
